recipes.title: Heals
recipes.description: With just 5 simple ingredients you can make the most delicious stove-top oatmeal recipe on the planet. This oatmeal recipe is a staple in my home and I often add other flavors and add-ins to make it even more delicious. PS: it's refined sugar-free and naturally gluten-free!

instructions.description: Combine all ingredients into a small saucepan and turn heat to medium/high
Bring to a boil.Then ,turn heat to low/medium and consistency stir for around 3-5 minutes as the oatmeal cooks and thickens
Once oatmeal is at desired consistency,remove from heat and serve imidantely

recipes.title: Bread for everyday

instructions.description: Mince the yeast in the cup, add a teaspoon of sugar and some lukewarm water
Stir and let the warm yeast rise.
Mix flour, spoonful of sugar and salt in a bowl. In the middle, make a hole, pour oil and yeast into it, stir a little and add lukewarm water. The exact amount of water depends on the flour itself.
With the electric mixer, knead the dough until it has an elastic dough that just deviates from the bowl.
It is then manually kneaded into a loaf and allowed to rise in a rising bowl until it has doubled.
When it is sufficiently uplifted, shake it on a dampened surface and fold over well again.
I usually design it as a loaf and place it in an elongated model lined with baking paper. Place the model warm so that the dough rises again
Place the dough in a preheated oven on a medium griddle and bake at 220 degrees for 15 minutes and then at 200 degrees for 20 minutes.
The baked bread is taken out of the model with the help of baking paper and placed on a griddle to cool.
